wikipedia_page.main: Sir Thomas Milvain   (4 May 1844 – 13 September 1916) was an English lawyer and Conservative Party politician.

response: The Conservatives first hoped that Cornwallis might be persuaded to stand again The Times,  16 February 1901 p12 but he did not wish to put his name forward and they chose instead Sir Thomas Milvain KC, the former MP for Durham and a barrister, having been called to the bar at the Middle Temple in 1869.Debretts Guide to the House of Commons 1886
Thomas Milvain had been Conservative MP for the seat of Hampstead since the 1902 Hampstead by-election. Milvain resigned the seat when he was appointed Judge Advocate General.
